import java.io.FileWriter;   // Import the FileWriter class
import java.io.IOException;  // Import the IOException class to handle errors
* Programme which serves as an interactive checklist.
* @param filePath represents the path of the file and existing tasks to be loaded
* Runs through live user input to add, edit the tasks.
* Creates an instance of Duke and runs it.
* @param description string which describes the task.
* Returns a formatted string representing the Event task.

* To retrieve the status of the task

return (isDone ? "X" : " "); // mark done task with X
* Changes the value of isDone to be true.
* Changes the value of isDone to be false.
* To display the task to the user and data log.

* Contains the task list e.g., it has operations to add/delete tasks in the list
* If an existing list is present, pass the data
* through the parser to retrieve data and therefore the tasks.
* @param taskList string of data from text file.
* @param task to be added to the List.
* Add string into a task which is then added to the List.

System.out.println("What can I do for you?");
System.out.println("Bye. Hope to see you again soon!");
* Prints the error message for loading error.
System.out.println("System data could not be loaded!");
* Prints the error message for empty description.
System.out.println("  OOPS!!! The description of a todo cannot be empty.");
* Prints the error message for invalid commands.
System.out.println(" OOPS!!! I'm sorry, but I don't know what that means :-(");
* Prints the message for marking a task as done.
* @param task is the task which is marked as done.
System.out.println("Nice! I've marked this task as done: ");
* Prints the message for marking a task as done.
*  @param task is the task which is marked as undone.
System.out.println("OK, I've marked this task as not done yet:");
